data.title: showSaveDialog should have optional options
data.body:
Testing #34821

Not passing options should be the same as:

```js
showSaveDialog({ filters: {} });
```

Same for `showOpenDialog`.

data.title: vscode-ripgrep ships 5MB of unused node_modules at runtime
data.body: Additionally, it ships on Windows the OSX binary ... or something.... :|

data.title: SaveDialogOptions.filters should be optional
data.body:
Testing #34821

The property `filters` in `SaveDialogOptions` should be optional.

Same for `showOpenDialog`.

data.title: Select providers are forgotten on reload
data.body:
re: #34963

* select a few source control providers
* reload the window
* :bug: selection is gone

data.title: opening a file using code --wait does not wait to quit
data.body:
Testing #34764

- Open VS Code with a folder.
- Now from terminal, open a file from a different folder and has `.vscode` folder in it using `--wait`

Expected the command waits but it terminates immediately

data.title: Tasks: possible to run multiple of the same task -> broken terminal dropdown
data.body:
Refs: #34953

1. Follow the test plan, run the watch task in a multi folder workspace
2. Delete that entry from tasks.json, run that task again
3. Notice you have two of the same tasks running now (which you are prohibitin in other places)
4. Now terminate one of those tasks, with the task: terminate action (terminate the second one if the first one is shown in the terminal)
5. Notice the terminal dropdown becomes blank and looks broken

There might be some other breakage with having two of the same tasks running, this is the one I noticed.

![screen shot 2017-09-26 at 11 57 29](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1926584/30854450-f0cd7cc8-a2b1-11e7-9eba-c15a777b0d88.png)

data.title: No keybinding support in SCM master view
data.body:
re #34963

* have many repos open
* in the master view try standard shortcuts like <kbd>Cmd+A</kbd> to select all or <kbd>Esc</kbd> to cancel multi-select

data.title: keytar ships 6MB
data.body: keytar should get the same treatment (deleting debugging symbols) as the other native node modules we ship.

data.title: Ignoring task configuration message pesters the user all the time
data.body:
Refs: #34953

1. Currently we show the "Ignoring task configuraiton" message every time a user runs a task
2. There is absolutely no way for the user to say never show this again

It seems like you are also showing this message whenever a user edits a tasks.json which feels wrong.
Why not use the message service instead, with a never show again action?

data.title: SCM: bogus question for where to create branch
data.body:
Testing: #35034

Clicking on branch action from a repository and selecting "Create new branch" asks again for which repository to use. It should remember the choice I made initially and not ask again.

![flicker_chrome58](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/900690/30854047-cde81070-a2b0-11e7-8775-692d0eac15ac.gif)

data.title: Tasks output covers terminal running the task
data.body:
Refs: #34953

1. Follow the steps for multi root workspace in the testplan
2. Once you run the npm compile task notice that the Output panel is opened with the message how tasks 0.1.0 are not supported in multi root folder
3. I am puzzled as to where my output is and if my task actually got ran
4. What actually happened is that my task was ran in the terminal, however the output deprecation message comes on top. Since this is less important than my actuall task output I would expect the task output on top

data.title: Outfile attribite not generated when TS file is open
data.body: Testing #34993 I followed the steps in #34993 but no outFiles property was created even if a TS file is open. I always get: Note, that I have a package.json without a main entry. I would also argue that the outFiles property is taken from the tsconfig.json file options outDir or outFile.

data.title: More aggressive  auto-added SCM provider removal
data.body:
re #34963

* have workspace with SCM
* open a file from another SCM managed folder/workspace
* you see another provider being added to the SCM viewlet which is good
* now close the file from step 2
* 🐛 the SCM provider is still there, enough I didn't make a change, the repo isn't dirty, the file is gone... I think in such cases (last files of a foreign repo disappears) we should also remove the provider again. Today it makes the "reading a file"-workflow more heavy weight

data.title: SCM: repository actions grow out of tree item bounds on click
data.body:
Testing: #35034

The animation on click causes the icon to leave the bounds of the tree. I actually think the animation really does not work well within a tree item where there is not a lot of space:

![flicker_chrome58](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/900690/30853702-d73ca948-a2af-11e7-9058-724703e3115f.gif)

data.title: SCM: repository status could get some alignment
data.body:
Testing: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/35034

I think visually it would be nice if the repository status would be aligned at least on the left hand side. We always seem to have the branch icon followed by the branch name and I think the branch icon should always show aligned across all repositories:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/900690/30853590-82c881ac-a2af-11e7-81da-605e85c19e3e.png)

data.title: Do not expose "multi root" in UX
data.body:
Refs: #34953

Currently in our UX we never expose the "multi root". Due to that I propose to change the following message: 

"Multi root folder support requires that all folders use task version 2.0.0"

"Multi folder workspace task support requires that folders use task version 2.0.0"

p.s. I did not check if you are using multi root in other messages, maybe just do a full text search

data.title: SCM: status bar should indicate the repository it shows information about
data.body:
Testing: #34963 

I think we should indicate the repository that we are showing status for from the status bar to the left of the branch. Clicking this repository could just open the SCM viewlet where the user can click on another one. If the user picks multiple, we could still just take the first. The important thing here is to make it clear which repository a branch belongs to.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/900690/30853488-3cc7ed50-a2af-11e7-8a01-015e907c2833.png)

data.title: SCM: last "active" repositories is not remembered
data.body:
Testing: #34963

I think we should preserve the choice of the user for a given workspace which SCM repositories are selected. This applies to:
* the SCM view itself (can be multiple)
* the status bar

data.title: Explorer viewlet contributions render title twice
data.body: @sandy081 assigning to you since all of them render the title twice.

data.title: SCM view should be customizable

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/34963

The same as the explorer: it should be possible to always show/hide the "SCM Repositories" view, even if there is just one repo. And if there is multiple I should be able to hide it. We could always allow to change the active SCM repo from the "..." menu too.

data.title: Tasks: do not show task selection picker if there is only one choice
data.body:
Refs: #34953

1. Have exactly one task running
2. tasks > terminate task or restart running task
3. Notice the user is presented with a quick pick as a choice to pick which task to terminate even though there is only one choice. I think the UI and the exeprience would be cleaner if we do not ask the user if there is only one choice

data.title: Explorer: not possible to drag a root folder to terminal to paste the path
data.body: We seem to be too restrictive about disabling DND for root folders in the explorer.

data.title: SCM: initialize git repo is weird

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/34963

I am not sure I get this action:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/900690/30853005-c190ce32-a2ad-11e7-8b71-fa8ac6c78557.png)

I am being asked where to initialize the repository, but what if that path is outside of the opened workspace? Even worse, when I have no workspace open, I am still being asked, but then shouldn't we open that folder of the repo?

Imho this action should always init the git repo in one of the workspace folders and be disabled if no folder is opened. If multiple folders are opened, the user should be asked. 

Also, this action is hidden as soon as any repository is shown but I might still want to "git init" in one of my workspace folders.

data.title: Unable to write into tasks.json creates a very confusing experience
data.body:
Refs: #34953

1. Have some workspace with tasks, for example one mentioned in the linked testplan item
2. Have some small error in your tasks.json, like an extra comma on the end of the `"tasks"` array
3. Run some task, when asked if he should scan output say "Never scan"
4. I always get the attached error
5. This is very confusing due to the fact that clicking on the "Open Settings" the workspace `settings.json` gets opened, not the `tasks.json`. Also the error makes the user believe something is wrong in his `settings.json` which is wrong

![screen shot 2017-09-26 at 11 21 56](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1926584/30852780-3971cb96-a2ad-11e7-9edd-b754e25689ce.png)

data.title: Pressing backtick replaces selection instead of wrapping it
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.16.0 (787b31c0474e6165390b5a5989c9619e3e16f953, 2017-09-06T16:19:37.192Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.12.13-300.fc26.x86_64
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
EditorConfig|Edi|0.10.1
vscode-docker|Pet|0.0.18
python|don|0.7.0
restructuredtext|lex|37.0.0
hg|mrc|1.1.7
language-gettext|mro|0.0.2
qub-xml-vscode|qub|1.2.8
sass-indented|rob|1.4.2



---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Write `hello`
2. Select `hello`
3. Press `"` ➡️ it becomes `"hello"` ✔️ 
4. Press `` ` `` (backtick) ➡️ it becomes ``"`"`` 🚫  ➡️ it should become ``"`hello`"``

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Bad master/child metaphor
data.body: re #34963 The new SCM master/child UI uses UX controls/metaphors that we use in other places to fence off pieces, e.g "Open Editor" vs "Folders", "Callstack" vs "Watched Variables", "Installed" vs "Recommended Extension" etc. None of those usage have a master/child relationship and I think its in-consistnet, unexpected, and confusing see see the SCM viewlet re-purpose those controls in a master/child mannar

data.title: Tasks: support snippets

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Refs: #34953

1. Open `tasks.json` and trigger inteli-sense inside the "tasks" array
2. Notice there are no suggestions, IMHO snippets would make this editing experience nicer

data.title: Tasks: clicking on configure action in quick open should open exact tasks.json location

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
Refs: #34953

1. Have a long `tasks.json` file
2. List all tasks in quick open, notice that each task has a configure action next to it, click on some configure button
3. Notice that the `tasks.json` gets opened on a previously edited location, not at the location where the task that I explicitly cliked on is

If we improved this in tasks land it would also allign better with how we open launch.json currently.
